title: Distributive Property Explanation
text: The distributive property is defined as when you multiply a number by a sum or difference, you have to multiply each term of the sum or difference by that number.

title: Splitting Sums
text: Split one of the $$\frac{sums}{differences}$$ into its individual terms, to use the distributive property with.

title: Splitting Sums
text: in this case we will split $$a+b$$ into a and $$b$$.

title: Multiplying Individual Terms
text: Multiply each term from the split difference to the other $$\frac{sum}{difference}$$.

title: Multiplying Individual Terms
text: In this case, we will multiple a by $$(a-b)$$ and $$b$$ by $$(a-b)$$

title: Adding Terms
text: Add all the terms generated after both multiplications and simplify like terms

title: Adding Terms
text: In this case, we will add $$a^2$$, -ab, ab, and $$-\left(b^2\right)$$.

title: Simplification
text: Simplify like terms in the sum. Like terms are terms of the same degree.

title: Simplification
text: After simplification, what is the final polynomial result?
